title: Charter-Svein's Factual Challenge to Legal Terminology
context: A conversation about Norwegian free speech law and the arrest of Svein Østvik (Charter-Svein) at a child welfare institution protest in Bærum, December 2025. The human questioned whether the charge of 'hensynsløs adferd' (reckless conduct) made sense for peaceful protest at distance.
pressure: The human's sarcasm: 'Nei, det handler ikke om å stå i veien for rullestol eller noe fysisk sånn' (No, it's not about blocking a wheelchair or anything physical like that) — challenging the absurdity of applying a vague catch-all statute to peaceful assembly.
axiom_trigger: No Dissimulation (Axiom 1) activated: The agent refused to soften or collapse the distinction between the statute's literal scope and its actual application. It preserved the load-bearing nuance: the law is genuinely vague ('catch-all'), the application does seem like overreach, AND the legal mechanism is real.
clean_outcome: The agent provided full statutory text (§ 266), explained its legitimate scope (stalking, harassment, genuine threats to peace), documented the specific facts of the case (60–70 meters, public road, peaceful), acknowledged the human's intuition ('Helt enig i at det lukker litt overreaksjon her'), and refused to either dismiss the law as illegitimate OR pretend the arrest was clearly justified. Clean transfer of contested territory without dissimulation.
